annotation: (7), "To lie down in order to sleep"

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect

annotation: Mon-Khmer borrowing but appears to reconstruct to Proto-Chamic

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: also has the variants, tunuga     and tinuga to disambiguate meanings
could be: ma mavu ta. ta could be fa
ultimately borrowed from Mon-Khmer but reconstructs to Proto-Chamic
Two POc forms are well supported(continues PMP)
PCP shows a replacement innovation, reflected by Fijian moce, mose, Rotuman mose, PPn *mohe.  PCP *mo(c,s)e has probable antecedents in POc but shows semantic shift.
to dose slumber or be drowsy
(10), ref. to Ata ma ʔabi "to lie down"
WP: dura, ndura L: dura VL, VLP: dúra
